articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: It was the first attack within city limits as Israel escalated hostilities against Iran's allies in the region.
articles.title: Apartment building in Beirut hit as Israel widens air campaign

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah will choose a successor to its slain secretary-general Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah "at the earliest opportunity" and will continue the fight against Israel, the Iran-backed group's deputy chief Naim Qassem said on Monday.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah will pick new leader at earliest opportunity, says its deputy chief

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Austria's far-right Freedom Party (FPO) must on Monday seek to clear a path to power after its historic parliamentary election victory left the anti-establishment outfit needing a partner to form a governing coalition.
articles.title: Austrian far right seeks path to power through rivals' blockade

articles.author: Louis Van Boxel-Woolf
articles.description: Picknicking with friends in the park after prayers at a Vienna mosque, Saima Arab, a 20-year-old pedicurist originally from Afghanistan, is thankful for her freedoms in Austria.
articles.title: Austria's rightward shift puts immigration in crosshairs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's incoming prime minister, Shigeru Ishiba, will fill key party posts on Monday followed by a new Cabinet on Tuesday as he tries to unite his party after one of the ruling LDP's closest ever leadership races and ahead of a general election.
articles.title: Japan's incoming PM Ishiba fills posts after close leadership race

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: A South Korean court on Monday sentenced the former police chief of a district of Seoul to three years in prison for a botched response to a deadly Halloween crowd crush in the capital's Itaewon nightlife district in 2022.
articles.title: South Korea Halloween crush: police officials jailed over 'man-made' tragedy

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: NATO's next boss, Mark Rutte, will need all the coalition-building skills he honed as Dutch prime minister to hold the Western alliance together amid war in Ukraine, fears over Moscow's next move and political uncertainty in Washington.
articles.title: Mark Rutte's NATO mission: rally West, reassure East, help Ukraine

articles.author: Gopal Sharma
articles.description: Nepal began on Monday to grapple with damage wrought by deadly floods and landslides triggered by heavy rains as residents faced the daunting task of cleaning homes and extracting their broken belongings from mud.
articles.title: Nepal begins to assess damage after deadly rains, floods kill 192

articles.author: Cassandra Garrison
articles.description: There could be a live mariachi band, clips from old Mexican movies, or the photo of a journalist being scolded for their coverage: the only sure thing with outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador's daily press conference is that it will be long – often upwards of three hours.
articles.title: First test for Mexico's new president? Marathon daily press conferences

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 12 people died, including three infants, and 10 others were missing after their boat sank on Monday off the Tunisian coast at Djerba as they sought to cross the Mediterranean to Europe.
articles.title: At least 12 die, 10 missing as migrant boat sinks off Tunisia
